name: Fresh Crop Balanced
descriptor: Weigh your options, then choose a seasonally rotating blend that stays in balance with a sweet-silky combination of coffees from Central and South America.
roasternotes: Fresh Crop is a blend for those who want complexity, consistency and quality in the cup. The coffees will change with the seasons, but the flavor profile of caramel, chocolate and stone fruit attributes will never waver. Fresh Crop Balanced is a seasonally rotating blend of coffees from Guatemala, Honduras or Colombia. Great for filter or espresso.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Milk Chocolate and Brown Sugar

name: Telemetry Blend
descriptor: Two are better than one—at least in this evolving blend based on two prime, in-season offerings. They’re mixed and matched to keep it sweet (but balanced).
roasternotes: Telemetry is a flavor forward blend composed of two fresh crop single origin coffees from our seasonal offerings. The blend is designed around an African component, which presents a floral, fruit-driven flavor profile, that is then balanced with the Central or South American component to balance and enhance sweetness. Components rotate seasonally to ensure the flavors are always vibrant and fresh.
flavornotes: Hints of Florals, Ripe Fruit and Brown Sugar

name: Toketee
descriptor: You’re fancy, huh? So is this elevated take on the classic drip, blend. It’s carefully curated, seasonally rotating, and of course—cultured.
roasternotes: Toketee is an elevated take on the classic drip blend, showcasing carefully curated, seasonally rotating coffees from Central and South America.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Milk Chocolate and Sweet Vanilla

name: Colombia La Primavera Decaf
descriptor: Behold: A decaf coffee that tastes like coffee. Rich, dense and a little sweet (owing to its slow and careful Colombian processing).
roasternotes: Not your traditional decaf, this green coffee is approved before it’s decaffeinated to ensure it is above speciality grade and free of defects. Caffeine is removed with a sugarcane molasses solvent to keep the coffee tasting like coffee. Best of all? It's a Colombian coffee processed in Colombia, reducing its carbon footprint.
flavornotes: none

name: FTW (For The Win)
descriptor: As espresso, as cold brew, as filter drip—this is straightforward, clean, balanced coffee that pleases a crowd, any time of day. AKA: Winning.
roasternotes: "For The Win" is a balanced blend that will satisfy your palate, but won’t break your weekly coffee budget. That’s a tasty win/win for everyone. This blend's components are a rotating selection of coffees from Latin America and Africa meant to maintain FTW's balanced, yet delicious profile. A crowd pleaser whether brewed as espresso, cold brew or filter.
flavornotes: Hints of Brown Sugar, Nut and Milk Chocolate

name: Stoker
descriptor: Here’s a coffee that dabbles in dark, for those who can’t decide. It’s a blend, and it’s mellow with a dark twist (like our favorite fiction).
roasternotes: We made this blend for those folks that were begging for a dark roast. It's not really that dark. It's kinda dark. You'll probably like it.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Milk Chocolate and Brown Sugar

name: Decaf Espresso Novo
descriptor: For those late-night cortado cravings - a depth of flavor that stands up to milk as well as it stands up to decaf-naysayers.
roasternotes: Our decaf espresso provides wonderful espresso flavors to any coffee drink without the burden of caffeine- perfect for late night drinking and for anyone sensitive to caffeine, but has a love for espresso.
flavornotes: none

name: Espresso del Fuego
descriptor: Que calor! Rich and sweet, this espresso roast pulls a great shot - but it's excellent in an auto-drip machine or a French press, too. Rich chocolate and caramel notes stand up to milk and sugar, but this is just as delicious black.
roasternotes: Espresso del Fuego is a rich espresso with a caramel-y finish.
flavornotes: none

name: Chronic Super Dank
descriptor: Deep, dark and rich, with notes of dried cherry and layers of baking spices. Perfect to pair with a splash of milk, or brewed bold and black.
roasternotes: Aromas of dried fruit and cherry, flavors of dark chocolate, cedar and clove aftertastes, a muted acidity, a bold body and a light sweetness.
flavornotes: Classic, nostalgic, comforting flavors

name: Andino, Colombia
descriptor: This is a coffee-shelf MVP. It’s sweet and fruity, yet grounded and can be brewed any way you like—from iced to immersion. Game over.
roasternotes: One of our most versatile coffees, this all-around star from the farmers of the Andino group is at once chocolatey, fruity and grounded. Iced, filter, espresso or immersion--it's good no matter how you choose to brew.
flavornotes: none

name: Gran Galope, Colombia
descriptor: Sweet with a side of sparkle, here’s a balanced cup that evens out acidity with a sweet-as-honey finish.
roasternotes: This workhorse Excelso features gently sparkling acidity with a balance of caramel and chocolate sweetness, as well as an almond nuttiness.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Colombia with hints of Brown Sugar and Milk Chocolate

name: House Blend
descriptor: The buzz of your favorite coffee spot, the comforts of home. Here’s the perfect balance, always with a twist of brightness to stave off boredom.
roasternotes: Bring our coffee shop into your kitchen: House Blend is a rotating blend of seasonal coffees created to be balanced and interesting. You will always find a nice apple-acidity and a creamy malt mouth feel.
flavornotes: Hints of Nut, Ripe Fruit and Sweet Vanilla

name: OMG (Oh My God)
descriptor: Oh my Guatemala, this is a good blend (the other half comes from Ethiopia). Sip its balanced richness and try not to shout it out loud (or post it on social).
roasternotes: "Oh My God" is our flagship blend designed for those OMG espresso moments. This blend is made with a rotating selection of seasonal coffees. It creates a well-balanced espresso on its own and a luscious drink when paired with milk. Enjoy it as espresso or filter coffee. OMG will stimulate your taste buds and make your day awesome.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Milk Chocolate and Citrus

name: Rwanda, Kanyege
descriptor: Two hundred small farmers unite to cultivate this sweet, lightly toasted coffee you’ll want to share (but may choose to keep to yourself).
roasternotes: Kanyege is a washing station owned and operated by Alphonse Kayijuka, located on the Western part of the Nyamasheke district, with an elevation of 1868 meters above sea level. All coffee is processed using dry fermentation methods for at least twelve hours, then dried on raised beds for 15 to 22 days. Kanyege is supplied by a group of around 200 small farmers from the sector surrounding the washing station. Notes of meyer lemon and sweet, baked rhubarb.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Citrus, Brown Sugar and Ripe Fruit

name: Organic Guatemala Concepción
descriptor: Chocolatey warmth is well balanced by bright lemony acidity in this smooth, clean cup.
roasternotes: Milk chocolate sweetness that is well balanced with a lemon-toned brightness, finishing with a subtle stone fruit aftertaste.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Guatemala with hints of Milk Chocolate and Berry Fruit

name: Burundi - Gishubi
descriptor: Dark fruit sweetness and a full, dense body offer an exceptionally decadent cup. Airship's partnership with the Long Miles Coffee Project has produced truly beautiful coffees.
roasternotes: Airship Coffee is proud to partner with the Long Miles Coffee Project in Burundi. Year after year, the team at Long Miles aids to produce amazing coffee out of Burundi, as well as some truly beautiful stories.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Burundi with hints of Brown Sugar and Sweet Vanilla

name: Colombia Diego and Marta Casso
descriptor: Diego and Marta Casso are a dynamite pair producing dynamite coffees. This one is sweet and smooth, with a sweetness reminiscent of blueberry coffee cake.
roasternotes: The sweet fruit tones and smooth finish of this micro-lot from the Monserrate Grower's Association in Colombia will leave no doubt why we buy all of Diego and Marta Casso's product. We have been buying their coffee since 2014.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Colombia with hints of Milk Chocolate and Brown Sugar

name: Papua New Guinea Amuliba
descriptor: Rainy-day motivation, served hot. Rich and chocolaty, with notes of vanilla and warming spices. Ideally sipped slowly (perhaps under blankets).
roasternotes: This coffee is produced by the Karkopi Company, a group owned by 48 shareholders. The plantation totals 91 hectares and is designed to use shade cover to minimize the use of chemicals.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Papua New Guinea with hints of Milk Chocolate and Spice

name: Monaco
descriptor: Monaco is known as neutral territory, but this blend takes a stand: Drawing on a long history, it melds tradition with a twist of brightness.
roasternotes: Monaco has all the delicious decadence of a chocolate-covered currant. Named for a small principality with a huge historical impact, this coffee fulfills the chocolatey tradition of coffee while verging into exciting fruit flavors.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Milk Chocolate and Earthiness

name: Ethiopia Guji
descriptor: With a tea-like profile, this coffee from the Guji Zone is filled with elegant florals & showcases the very best expression of this storied growing region.
roasternotes: Stumptown has developed a deep love for the Guji cup profile which often expresses tea-like qualities. We carefully selected lots to showcase the best coffees from the Guji Zone.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Citrus, Florals and Spice

name: Ethiopia Debo
descriptor: Bright, complex and refreshing - a perfect summer brew. This one's got the citrusy brightness and sweet floral notes to keep you shining your brightest when the weather's hot.
roasternotes: Debo comes to us from the Debo washing station in Kochere, and we're gonna be slamming it all summer. It's bright, floral, complex, and refreshing, perfect for the hot weather over the next few months.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Florals, Citrus and Florals

name: Ethiopia Kercha
descriptor: We're loving this immensely sweet cup, which reminds us of a perfectly brewed Earl Grey tea. A smooth and creamy body delivers some serious lingering floral notes.
roasternotes: We were tasting about 25 new Ethiopian samples and we hit this Kercha and fell in love. Unbelievably sweet, loud florality, and extreme earl grey & bergamot notes came from the cup. While these notes may seem in tune with high-quality lots from the Sidamo region, they usually have a thinness in the cup. This coffee has a thick creamy body to go along with these notes and achieves that rare form of balance while still being exciting.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Florals, Berry Fruit and Sweet Vanilla

name: Nano Challa Washed
descriptor: Gorgeously lush, fruity and complex, this is a tropical indulgence fit for the sunniest mornings. Look for tropical fruit notes, jasmine aromatics and notes of bergamot in the lingering finish.
roasternotes: This washed heirloom coffee from Ethiopia's Nano Challa Cooperative is sweet, floral, and complex. When brewed, we found jasmine and dark brown sugar in the aroma. The body is juicy, with a flavor of fresh coconut and honeydew, and a wild strawberry acidity. Look for notes of mango and a spicy hint of bergamot in the lush finish.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Florals, Tropical Fruit and Ripe Fruit

name: Organic Ethiopia Idido
descriptor: Sweet, clean and delicate, full of floral aromatics and a gentle citrusy acidity.
roasternotes: Aromatics of spring flowers and musk melon, give way to a round, honeyed body and a sparkling, clean finish.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Citrus, Florals and Ripe Fruit

name: El Salvador Finca Manzano
descriptor: Easy-drinking and super approachable, this is a great single origins for coffee lovers of all levels. We're finding a pear-like acidity and brown sugar sweetness in a smooth, clean body.
roasternotes: A balanced and approachable cup with notes of toffee, pear, and graham. This is the first single-origin release in a collaboration between Finca Manzano and Blueprint Coffee. This collaboration is rooted in an exploration and analysis of soil heath programs.
flavornotes: A classic expression of El Salvador with hints of Brown Sugar and Sweet Vanilla

name: Kenya Gichathaini PB
descriptor: Clean and crisp, with juicy tropical fruit notes up front. We're finding subtle floral notes and lingering sweetness as the cup cools.
roasternotes: Located on the slopes of Mt. Kenya in the center of the country lies one of the most famous coffee growing regions in the world named Nyeri. The Gichathaini Factory (washing station) has been producing coffees known for tropical overtones and delicate florals for years. This year's harvest is no different. Bright, mouthwatering acidities flavors such as kiwi and pomegranate make this coffee special.
flavornotes: none

name: Guatemala Finca Isnul
descriptor: Clean, sweet, buttery, with a vibrant citric acidity. If you could turn a key lime pie into a coffee, this would be it.
roasternotes: Located in Guatemala lies an incredibly special farm called Finca Isnul. They specializes in meticulously prepped coffees of the Pacamara varietal. Bright, juicy kaffir lime acidity with subtle, sweet pecan notes animate from the cup. Our friend Danny Perez has grown, processed, and milled an outstanding coffee. The farm has achieved some of the highest awards of coffee farming placing in the Cup of Excellence in 2008, 2009, 2012, 2017, & 2018.
flavornotes: none

name: Kenya Kabare Konyu
descriptor: Bold and full-bodied, with a sharp blackberry tang like a spoonful of jam. Notes of pear and chocolate soften the acidity somewhat, but this one remains an intense cup.
roasternotes: This offering comes to us from the Kabare Farmer's Cooperative Society in the Kirinyaga district, nestled high on the southern slopes of Mount Kenya. The coffee is grown in rich volcanic soil and processed with fresh river water at the Konyu factory for a crisp yet luscious taste. Kenyan coffees are some of our favorite offerings to feature because they provide customers with bold and balanced cups. Enjoy!
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Berry Fruit, Sweet Vanilla and Milk Chocolate

name: Kanake, Kenya
descriptor: Bright and beautiful, with vibrant grape acidity and notes of tangy hibiscus and sultry clove in a sticky-sweet, syrupy body.
roasternotes: High altitude, bright red soils, and thoughtful cultivation from the farmer-owners of the Kanake mill makes for a singular coffee.
flavornotes: none

name: Furry Creatures
descriptor: Sweet and approachable, and it'll love you unconditionally - just like the pets at PAWS Chicago who benefit from the proceeds.
roasternotes: Furry Creatures is a token of our admiration for PAWS Chicago. With 100% of the proceeds going to their cause, it’s a way for us to marry our skill-set of making delicious coffee to benefit a quality npo. With a round body and smooth acidity, you can enjoy this 100% Guatemala (Caramel, Nutmeg, Pear ) with cream or neat: either way, it won’t bite.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Brown Sugar and Spice

name: Costa Rica Montes de Oro
descriptor: Citrus flavors. Creamy finish. This single-origin was carefully cultivated from Costa Rica. And you’ll want to savor every last sip.
roasternotes: Creamy butterscotch is complemented by lively lemon in this balanced offering from the mountainous Tarrazu region.
flavornotes: none

name: Guatemala Aragon
descriptor: With its crisp red apple acidity and buttery-sweet notes of pecan pie, this coffee is downright Autumnal. We're digging its creamy body and we think you will too.
roasternotes: This year’s Aragon returns with a crisp, red apple acidity along with a buttery, pecan-like mouthfeel.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Guatemala with hints of Nut and Brown Sugar

name: Guatemala Flora Ramos
descriptor: Full of juicy fruity sweetness with a soft apple acidity, this clean cup leaves you with a lingering melon sweetness.
roasternotes: Sweet apple flavors and a juicy watermelon finish describe this Huehuetenango micro-lot.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Ripe Fruit, Florals and Brown Sugar

name: Guatemala Pulcal Yellow Bourbon
descriptor: Super subtle and balanced, this is a great place to start converting the tea drinkers in your life. Subtle notes of dried peach and a slightly drying white tea acidity
roasternotes: Subtle stone fruit notes evoke the qualities of dried peach. Tied-together with a honey-like sweetness and velvety texture, this year’s Pulcal returns to our menu, nearly as elegant as delightful Maria Zelaya herself.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Guatemala with hints of Florals and Ripe Fruit
extra: ['Process', 'Washed', 'Sub Region', 'Antigua', 'Producer', 'Maria Zelaya Aguirre', 'Harvest Time', 'December - March', 'Varietal', 'Yellow Bourbon', 'Elevation', '1600 - 1600']

name: Colombia Monserrate
descriptor: A classic Colombian coffee - chocolaty, nutty, and eager to please. This one's a treat for coffee drinkers of all levels.
roasternotes: This classic Colombian coffee yields a smooth cup with excellent balance. Enjoy its notes of dark chocolate, walnut, and raisin.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Colombia with hints of Milk Chocolate and Nut

name: Hunapu Guatemala
descriptor: It's easy to fall for this Guatemalan dreamboat. Juicy orange acidity, syrupy berry sweetness and delicate floral aromatics come together with just enough smooth, chocolaty structure to keep it all in balance. We're smitten.
roasternotes: The creamy, chocolate structure of this coffee comforts but it also delights as orange, berries, and subtle rose come through. This coffee is hard not to like.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Citrus, Milk Chocolate and Berry Fruit

name: Ethiopia Worka Sakaro
descriptor: Clean, crisp, classic. A delicate, tea-like body delivers floral aromas, juicy grape notes and citrusy acidity.
roasternotes: This coffee was grown in Gedeb, south of Yirgacheffe and processed at the Ato. Mijane station (Mr. Mijane’s station). Grown at around 1900 meters in healthy soil this is a clean, vibrant and classic example of a the classic Yirgacheffe profile: floral, black tea, lemon, rounded out by lovely grape and purple fruit flavors.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Florals, Sweet Vanilla and Citrus

name: Acatenango Gesha
descriptor: Simply luscious, with milk chocolate, caramel, and bergamot notes. Break out your fanciest mug.
roasternotes: Many coffees are bought and sold as Gesha. Few of those coffees posses the aromatic qualities and flavors that have made this unique heirloom variety so famous. This lot from Acatenango, Guatemala does. Jasmine and stone fruit aromatics on the nose make way for a cup that is lush with milk chocolate, caramel and bergamot notes. Remarkably graceful, this lot is very reminiscent of the Gesha found on Hacienda La Esmeralda in Boquete, Panama.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Florals, Milk Chocolate and Ripe Fruit

name: Indonesia Sumatra
descriptor: Sumatra holds a legandary place in the story of coffee. This perfect example is full bodied, sweet & light in acidity. French press to meet it's true character.
roasternotes: Indonesia’s island of Sumatra is one of the most renowned coffee producing regions in the world. Our Sumatran coffee is a full bodied and sweet cup of coffee that is light in acidity.
flavornotes: none

name: Equator Blend
descriptor: A perennial crowd-pleaser - chocolaty and nutty, but complex enough not to put you to sleep (quite the opposite, in fact).
roasternotes: This crowd-pleasing blend is rich and smooth, highlighting a deep-toned coffee from Sumatra. A fee is linked to each pound of coffee we purchase to fund the Sumatran Tiger Trust, a conservation group that helps preserve the endangered Sumatran Tiger. Fully washed coffees from Kenya and Colombia add elements of brightness and bring out the complex flavors of other coffees in this blend. This blend pairs well with milk but also tastes great on its own.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Nut and Spice

name: Milwaukee Rockstar Blend
descriptor: Find your rhythm with a full-bodied, lightly acidic coffee that brings down the house, every time. Your cup will want an encore.
roasternotes: South American and dark roasted coffee come together to form this sultry blend. A full, well-rounded body with a light acidity and smokey spice create the perfect coffee for those about to rock.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Milk Chocolate and Nut

name: Los Inmortales El Salvador
descriptor: Sweet and complex, with notes of plum and rich butterscotch. Get it while you can - this one won't be around too long.
roasternotes: MATALAPA EDITION | The first lot in our 2018 Los Inmortales lineup comes from Finca Matalapa, which has been an Intelligentsia Direct Trade partner since 2003 and has been growing coffee since the 1880s. Plum | Nectarine | Butterscotch
flavornotes: none

name: Intensi
descriptor: Bright as day, smooth as silk. There’s nothing cliche about a nuanced blend that tastes anything but predictable. Full and smooth with a big finish.
roasternotes: Intensi starts with full milk chocolate flavor followed by a bold vanilla coating, finishing with a bright berry taste.
flavornotes: none

name: El Pilar, Guatemala
descriptor: Reliable morning after morning, year after year, this roaster keeps turning to this Guatemalan gem for its solid and steady sweetness and bright acidity.
roasternotes: Year after year El Pilar emerges as one of our favorite Guatemalan coffees. Incredibly complex, this coffee presents flavors of dried pineapple, green apple and berries, held together by a distinct caramel-like sweetness.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Tropical Fruit, Ripe Fruit and Brown Sugar

name: Ethiopia Nano Challa
descriptor: Juicy peach and sweet-tart lemon notes shine in this sweet, clean, and refreshing cup.
roasternotes: In the cup, we're getting notes of juicy yellow peach, with a hint of lemon. All of this is balanced with a brown sugar sweetness. The experience is light, clean, and crisp.
flavornotes: none

name: FTO Decaf Espresso
descriptor: A blend of the best from Indonesia, Africa, Central and South America, without the jitters. And it’s impossibly good: mellow, sweet and clean.
roasternotes: FTO Klatch House is a remarkable blend of Indonesian, African, Central and South American coffees. This decaffeinated espresso is extremely rich, possibly the richest of all espressos. Ranging with great notes of deep cinnamon and a wealth of nut, wrapped in a luscious rich creamy body. All fair trade components blend together to create a fine espresso to be served on its own but still have a great depth to be harmonized with milk.
flavornotes: none

name: Color Wheel
descriptor: A nod to the Specialty Coffee Association's flavor wheel, this blend balances traditional and modern to present a truly vibrant cup. Skip a muddled rainbow and take a spin on this curated color wheel.
roasternotes: One of our more modern espresso variants, Color Wheel is a light blend with flavors spanning the taste spectrum. A nod to the Specialty Coffee Association's flavor wheel, this blend balances the most up-to-date in coffee without sacrificing approachability or deliciousness. Don't taste a muddled rainbow; spin the curated Color Wheel.
flavornotes: none

name: Colombia San Sebastian
descriptor: Smooth and sweet, nutty and rich. This one is as great with milk as it is on its own. Simply put, it's simply great.
roasternotes: San Sebastian is flavorful Colombian coffee that stands on its own as a tasty and flavorful cup of coffee!
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Citrus, Sweet Vanilla and Nut

name: Tarrazu French
descriptor: Enjoy this classic cup of coffee from a master among roasters. Deep and dark, with notes of rich caramel, walnut and cola. Milk drinkers, you're invited to this party.
roasternotes: Plumes of dark roast aromas. Intertwined rich caramel, walnut and cola notes. Tarrazu is a land of small farmers in a tumultuous landscape of lush green peaks, some rising over 10,000 feet, and valleys. The climate has well defined seasons: the long dry season, from December to April, coincides perfectly with the coffee harvest, leading to very even, full ripening - ideal for preparing quality coffee.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Costa Rica with hints of Milk Chocolate and Nut

name: Kurimi Organic Ethiopia
descriptor: Syrupy-bodied and candy-sweet, this masterfully balanced coffee lingers on the palate and reminds you of the better times (when you still had coffee in your mug).
roasternotes: Kurimi takes its name — and its inspiration — from an Amharic reference to excellence. This year's Kurimi delivers the mesmerizing floral aromatics that are its trademark and flavors of honeydew melon, passionfruit and lemon curd.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Ethiopia with hints of Ripe Fruit and Ripe Fruit

name: Black Magic - Espresso Blend
descriptor: Here’s espresso 101: No single bean can make it; it’s gotta be a blend. And this one stands up among the very best. Thick, rich and creamy, as it should be.
roasternotes: There is no single espresso coffee bean, only blends, and this one is a tribute to the classic espressos of Italy. We’ve peak-roasted our Black Magic espresso to focus on sweetness, developing a thick, rich crema with bright berry flavors and a touch of chocolate. Saluti!
flavornotes: none

name: Colombia Luis Reinoso
descriptor: Make good mornings, great mornings. This single origin is anything but ordinary with its fruity finish (a nod to its Colombian origin).
roasternotes: Luis has a small farm named Finca Vista Hermosa (“farm with a beautiful view”) in Campohermoso, Herrera. This coffee stands out with its vibrant flavors derived from high and consistent elevations, a great mico-climate, and attention to detail throughout its life.
flavornotes: none

name: West Pole Dark Roast
descriptor: Dark roasted but you won't find any smoke or ash in this cup - only rich, full-bodied flavors that show off the hard work of the producers behind this blend. (Formerly known as Mezzanote.)
roasternotes: Most people’s initial encounter with a dark roast is a cup full of smoke and ash, but we think coffee should be more than that. We strive to maintain distinctive origin flavors while softening the acidity and highlighting molasses and spice characteristics. This coffee is a shining example of our craft, providing enough roast development to please those who look for deep character, but applied with a delicate hand to still deliver a true coffee experience.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Roastiness and Milk Chocolate

name: Ethiopia Guji Organic
descriptor: Rich, silky body delivering big, juicy fruit sweetness and soft acidity. It's like a silky-smooth fruit explosion, in the best way.
roasternotes: Melon aromas, berry and chocolate flavors, brown sugar aftertastes, a smooth acidity, a silky body and a bold sweetness.
flavornotes: Packed with bold notes of Berry Fruit, Milk Chocolate and Berry Fruit

name: Santa Julia, El Salvador
descriptor: Sweet and citrusy, with a smooth butterscotch-and-marmalade thing going on that we could drink all day.
roasternotes: Elegant yet utterly "crushable," this sweet coffee from Finca Santa Julia is the perfect all-day cup.
flavornotes: none

name: Dark
descriptor: Sultry smokiness, meet creamy sweetness. Will opposites attract? They do in this dark cup that brings out the best of each quality.
roasternotes: This blend is based on a mix of creamy, nutty coffees roasted to bring out wisps of toasted caramel and hints of smoke yielding a rich and full coffee. We take this blend right before second crack, allowing the characteristics of the coffee to shine through the dry distillation qualities developed later in the roast.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Milk Chocolate and Roastiness
extra: ['Process', 'Washed', 'Varietal', 'Bourbon, Mundo Novo, Red and Yellow Catua, Topazio']

name: Klatch House Espresso
descriptor: No competition here: This much-awarded espresso blend puts its game face on in the form of semi-sweet, zesty, full-body flavored. Plays well with milk.
roasternotes: This rich, syrupy sweet chocolate espresso blend has been a competition winner, time and time again. Klatch House Espresso is the hallmark of semi-sweet chocolate, orange zest, cinnamon stick and walnut, with a full body. Great with milk.
flavornotes: none

name: Italian Roast
descriptor: Picture it: Venice. You and your favorite, a cafe, this coffee. You’ll go to there (if only in your head) with a sip of this rich, smooth, medium-dark blend.
roasternotes: This full bodied blend will give you a taste of the romantic Italian cafes of Venice, as if you are sitting alongside the canals with a wonderful cup of coffee in your hand. Rich and smooth.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Savoriness and Milk Chocolate

name: FTO Rainforest Blend
descriptor: Smooth with a side of surprise. Dark with a little light. That’s the rainforest. And this coffee with a combination of tastes that seem like a force of nature.
roasternotes: A perfect example of a smooth Central and South American taste. This organic blend offers sweet, smooth and robust flavors of dark chocolate, brown sugar and caramel. It also works great as espresso.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Milk Chocolate and Brown Sugar

name: Parts & Labor Blend
descriptor: Great materials here—the best Brazil and Ethiopian coffees—mean you won’t need to sweat the labor too much for a great cup. Its smooth body delivers every time.
roasternotes: This blend was created for sweetness, balance and more sweetness. It is a blend of pulp natural Brazil and Ethiopian coffees that give this cup a dense body, chocolate and hints of red fruit and floral notes. This is a great choice for both the coffee geek and the person who just wants to drink an uncomplicated but delicious cup of coffee. Great for espresso and any brewing you do at home.
flavornotes: Hints of Milk Chocolate, Brown Sugar and Sweet Vanilla

name: Black Magic - Espresso Blend
descriptor: Here’s espresso 101: No single bean can make it; it’s gotta be a blend. And this one stands up among the very best. Thick, rich and creamy, as it should be.
roasternotes: There is no single espresso coffee bean, only blends, and this one is a tribute to the classic espressos of Italy. We’ve peak-roasted our Black Magic espresso to focus on sweetness, developing a thick, rich crema with bright berry flavors and a touch of chocolate. Saluti!
flavornotes: none

name: Skeleton Key Decaf
descriptor: Coffee, hold the jolt. A solid and seasonal decaf with nutty sweetness that puts some meat on the bones (so to speak). Sip it freely, anytime of day.
roasternotes: Skeleton Key is a seasonally-rotating decaffeinated coffee chosen for versatility, with chocolatey and nutty sweetness and a round body. It works well as espresso or drip, with or without milk, and we only use Swiss Water Processed or Mountain Water Processed beans. We think it's tasty, and a great option for when we want coffee, without jitters.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Peru with hints of Milk Chocolate and Nut

name: Phocea
descriptor: Take a trip, in your cup. Inspired by a stop on the spice trail from Africa, this coffee blazes its own trail with a hint of spice enlivening a roasty base.
roasternotes: This coffee is about a journey--of spices, flavors, ideas. Phocea was inspired by the French city Marseille, which historically stood as the European entryway on the spice trail from Africa. With a roasty flavor and just a hint of black pepper, this brew is a gateway to new coffee experiences.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Milk Chocolate and Earthiness

name: Louisiane
descriptor: New Orleans-inspired coffee with go-marching-in boldness. Earthy and smooth, it explores everything about coffee that made us fall in love.
roasternotes: Louisiane, a bold and earthy brew, is a love letter to New Orleans, the original U.S. coffee town. This blend is about getting back to the roots of the American coffee tradition—and finding that mineral, smoky smoothness that got this country hooked on it in the first place.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Milk Chocolate and Earthiness

name: Afrique
descriptor: This one pays homage to coffee’s birthplace by celebrating everything we love about the stuff: roasty, earthy and bright. Perfect for parties and Mondays alike.
roasternotes: Africa. It’s where coffee originated. It’s home to thousands of farmers who cultivate the beautiful coffee fruit, and home to the heart of our founder, Todd Carmichael. This brew showcases the fruity potential of coffee without abandoning the traditional coffee flavors of cocoa and warm spices.
flavornotes: Hints of Berry Fruit, Nut and Spice

name: Wallabout
descriptor: Wallabout throws its weight around but you won't mind once your cup is filled with pure full-bodied comfort. Great for your french press & ready for milk.
roasternotes: Wallabout is our most stalwart offering currently being composed of Colombia Los Naranjos and Peru Sandia Valley. With Wallabout, we offer an expression which showcases coffee’s more comforting elements. In its current iteration Wallabout shows its weight with flavors of milk chocolate, molasses and bittersweet cocoa.
flavornotes: Hints of Milk Chocolate, Sweet Vanilla and Nut

name: Konga, Ethiopia
descriptor: Wake up before you go-go. The familiar citrus punch of this classic from coffee’s birthplace adds a twist of smooth spiciness to keep it interesting.
roasternotes: Classic Yirgacheffe profile, floral jasmine aromatics upfront with lemon zest, followed by plum sweetness and black pepper finish.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Florals, Citrus and Sweet Vanilla

name: Daterra
descriptor: Berry sweetness and barely-there acidity make this one easy to love. Hints of vanilla and cherry round out an exceptionally smooth cup.
roasternotes: A light roasted classic natural processed coffee from a country that has traditionally specialized in naturals because of its dry climate. Daterra selects only the ripest coffee cherries to slowly dry, yielding very sweet, vanilla tinged blueberry and cherry notes. This is a 100% Bourbon coffee for those who want sweetness with no bitterness and a bare minimum of acidity.
flavornotes: Packed with bold notes of Milk Chocolate, Berry Fruit and Sweet Vanilla

name: Decaf Colombia La Serrania
descriptor: Found: a solid decaf with classic Colombian flavor, no compromise. Blended with care to preserve its sweet but true-to-its roots taste.
roasternotes: Smallholder farmers throughout Huila contribute to La Serrania. This blend of lots is decaffeinated with a natural byproduct of Colombian-grown sugar cane. Our roast results in a superior decaf with fresh tropical fruit and molasses notes.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Colombia with hints of Brown Sugar and Tropical Fruit

name: Decaf Blackstrap
descriptor: Full-bodied & balanced with plenty of sweetness means it pairs perfectly with milk. Swiss Water Process decaffeination means there's no need to worry about jitters.
roasternotes: Smooth and inviting, a rich coffee with deep undertones of caramel, raisin and warm spices.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Milk Chocolate and Nut

name: Chicago House Blend
descriptor: Much like the city where house music started, here’s a blend that merges the fine art of Latin coffee-making with the friendly notes of citrusy sweetness.
roasternotes: The Chicago House blend is inspired by the genre of electronic dance music that originated in Chicago in the early 1980s. House music has been a staple in the Chicago music scene, and this blend is a staple in our line-up. A fine blend of coffees from Latin America that combine to bring out notes of milk chocolate, honey and lemon zest. This blend is balanced with flavors that will move your body and go on and on.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Milk Chocolate and Roastiness

name: Monte Carlo Decaf
descriptor: An odds-on favorite in the caffeine-free category. Full yet moderate in its approach, a rich flavor gives in to moderate acidity.
roasternotes: The quintessential classic decaf coffee with everything: rich flavor and aroma, full body and moderate acidity in perfect balance, yet without the caffeine. Monte Carlo is extraordinary in every brewing process from French press to filter coffee to espresso.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Milk Chocolate and Earthiness

name: Fishtown
descriptor: Compliments come quickly (no fishing required) for a bright and balanced coffee named for the roaster’s eclectic home base.
roasternotes: Named for the Philadelphia neighborhood that's home to our flagship café, the Fishtown seasonal blend has bright fruit flavors and ample balance. As complex and eclectic as our hometown.
flavornotes: Hints of Savoriness, Berry Fruit and Citrus

name: Rocketeer
descriptor: Ground control, this coffee needs to land in everyone’s lineup. Smooth and rich, spicy with a bit of citrus—it’s just a people pleaser.
roasternotes: A smooth blend of Honduras and Indonesia that yields a sweet cup of chocolate and spice with a faint hint of citrus.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Spice and Savoriness

name: Bitches Brew
descriptor: A smoky club, a smoky cup and all that jazz. Deep and stirring (even when stirred), like a legendary Miles Davis number, this is one to put on repeat.
roasternotes: Named after the legendary Miles Davis album, this blend is dark and electric, a noir classic for the ages. If you like your coffee like your jazz—incredibly dark, smoky and fascinating—Bitches Brew is for you.
flavornotes: Classic, nostalgic, comforting flavors

name: Blendo Stupendo
descriptor: This one reaches back to America’s coffee-drinking heritage with a blend that reads old-school but feels thoroughly right now.
roasternotes: Blendo Stupendo is the George Washington of coffee. Composed of top quality Central and South American beans, the Stupendo is sourced and roasted to taste like the coffee our country grew up drinking. With classic flavors like rich chocolate, caramel and a hint of toasted nuts, Stupendo will get you across the Delaware (or at least it’ll get you to work). Medium roasted for every preparation.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Milk Chocolate and Brown Sugar

name: Black Bear Blend
descriptor: Here’s a black bear you’ll run towards. Strong but velvety, dark and complex, it’s a welcome guest at breakfast (or anytime).
roasternotes: Complex, velvety and roasted darker to bring out a rich body.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Milk Chocolate and Roastiness

name: Bourbon
descriptor: This one’s inspired by the island of bourbon, which first cultivated this standout variety now grown worldwide. This bourbon may cause a buzz—but no hangover.
roasternotes: Our Bourbon blend is named after the Indian Ocean island where it was originally cultivated. Bourbon coffee is famous for its full body and delicate sweetness.
flavornotes: Hints of Tropical Fruit, Florals and Sweet Vanilla

name: The Waverly
descriptor: Everyone loves a classic—which is why this signature espresso is a fan favorite. It’s blended for balance, with a little bit of sweetness.
roasternotes: Named for our first store, the Waverly is our signature espresso, blended for balance, nuance and a syrupy body. The foundation of the blend is a coffee from the Cenfrocafe Cooperative in Cajamarca, Peru. It is accented by the San Carlos from Antigua, Guatemala, which adds a pleasant roundness to the blend.
flavornotes: none

name: Rally
descriptor: Welcome to your comfort zone. This Fair Trade Organic blend is mild and smooth, with a slightly milky base. Ready when you need to rally.
roasternotes: This Fair Trade Organic blend is mild and smooth, with a comforting milk chocolate base. Crowd-pleasing flavor makes this the perfect blend to kickstart any rally. Each blend starts with a flavor idea. The coffee team takes this idea into the cupping room, where they combine our rotating stock of fresh crop single-origin coffees and our roasters' expertise to build a unique blend that is greater than the sum of its parts.
flavornotes: Hints of Nut, Milk Chocolate and Berry Fruit

name: Organic Driftless
descriptor: You know when all your favorite stars are cast in one movie? That’s this coffee. A blend of fan favorites, guaranteed to hold your attention.
roasternotes: Here's a coffee for people who know what they like and like what they know. Classic, reliable, tried-and-true–call it whatever you like, Driftless is just plain lovely. Created by selecting popular Central and South American coffees, choosing the lots that have been crowd-pleasers in years past, and roasting them to a medium, cozy depth to make sure that goodness stays sweet and balanced.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Milk Chocolate and Brown Sugar

name: Nightcap House Decaf
descriptor: Decaffeinated using the Swiss Water process, this relaxed, easy drinking blend comes from a collaboration between Fincas Mierisch and the Pulley Collective.
roasternotes: We are especially proud of Nightcap, a decaffeinated offering made possible through our partnership with Fincas Mierisch and the Pulley Collective. This coffee has nuances of cocoa powder, honey and dried fruit. It is decaffeinated using the Swiss Water process.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Nicaragua with hints of Milk Chocolate and Sweet Vanilla

name: Decaf Angel City
descriptor: Organic and water-processed, this blend is 99.7% caffeine-free but still delivers plenty of crisp acidity. A perfect choice for an evening pour-over.
roasternotes: Just because it’s decaf doesn’t mean it has to be bland. This organic, water-processed blend has plenty of crisp acidity and aromatics throughout the cup. Guaranteed 99.7% caffeine-free, Decaf Angel City says, “Go ahead and grab the big cup.”
flavornotes: Hints of Berry Fruit, Brown Sugar and Milk Chocolate

name: Decaf Librarian's Blend
descriptor: Everything you could want from a high quality decaf. Smooth, chocolatey and nostalgic with just a touch of sparkle makes this your new go-to match any mood.
roasternotes: A smooth chocolate base with a bit of lime sparkle makes this water processed coffee a steady and reassuring choice.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Citrus and Nut

name: Hunky Dory Decaf
descriptor: The name says it all. This blend goes with the flow—changing its tune a bit with the seasons, but remaining a fan favorite.
roasternotes: Hunky Dory is a faithful friend with something for everyone to love. Not finicky about any particular brew method, the extraordinary qualities of this coffee shine through in every cup. We carefully adjust the blend as the seasons change to maintain the balance that has made Hunky Dory a favorite go-to in our lineup.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Brown Sugar and Ripe Fruit

name: Decaf Brazil
descriptor: One very indulgent cup of coffee, that happens to lack caffeine. Chocolatey and rich, with decadent caramel sweetness. Very, very good.
roasternotes: A sweet cup of coffee layered with caramel and honey sweetness on top of chocolate. A medium roast coffee with rounded flavor and a short-medium finish.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Milk Chocolate and Brown Sugar

name: Brazil Fazenda Primavera
descriptor: A versatile, easy-drinking coffee. Any way you brew it, we bet you'll enjoy its rich chocolatey notes and smooth finish.
roasternotes: One of the main assets of the Fazenda Primavera is its commitment to responding to new agricultural research and new trends in consumer preference. For example, microlots are dried on raised beds, coffee is intercropped with shade trees, and coffee is evaulated constantly to find the best cup profiles.
flavornotes: none

name: Karmadillo Dark Espresso Blend
descriptor: For those among us who live la vida mocha: here's your go-to. With incredible depth and chocolaty sweetness, this one packs a wallop you won't soon forget.
roasternotes: This Espresso is no joke. It packs a punch to feel as if you were brought back to life. The more developed roast profile was inspired by our founder's first trip to the Pacific North West, back in 2001. When combined with steamed milk, it tastes like you're drinking a mocha, without adding chocolate. This blend of Central and South American coffees is spiked with a little exotic flavor, from Sumatra and Ethiopia, to satisfy that wild streak in all of us.
flavornotes: Classic, nostalgic, comforting flavors

name: Burundi Karehe Single Origin Espresso
descriptor: Rich and luscious, full-bodied and chocolaty, sticky-sweet like cherry syrup. This one can take milk with the best of 'em, sure, but is plenty delicious all on its own.
roasternotes: This espresso offering comes to us from a Burundi cooperative composed of 508 farmers who are all members of the International Women in Coffee Association (IWCA.) The IWCA opened their Burundi chapter in 2011 and has empowered women in the area to develop skills and enhance their roles in Burundian society. This offering was washed and processed at the Karehe Washing Station, a facility that has historically produced award-winning coffees.
flavornotes: none

name: Decaf Chicago House Blend
descriptor: Caffeine’s gone, but flavor’s still in the house. Everything that works in the caffeinated version—sweet, velvety perfection—is still at play here.
roasternotes: Who says decaf coffee has to be flavorless? With notes of melon, caramel candy and dark chocolate, this coffee is roasted to a medium roast to retain the sweetness and complexity of the original coffees.
flavornotes: Hints of Nut, Milk Chocolate and Ripe Fruit

name: Crazy Goat
descriptor: High on a hill with a lonely goatherd...sums up the tale behind this complex blend that keeps things balanced but isn’t afraid to get a little crazy.
roasternotes: A full-bodied blend with a name dating back to the beginning of coffee when it was discovered by a goat herder named Kaldi. This is a robust blend with notes of dark chocolate, tobacco, and hints of spice in aroma and cup. Crazy Goat is perfect for those looking for a balanced but assertive cup.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Milk Chocolate and Spice

name: Papua New Guinea
descriptor: This silky blend makes a better cup while building better lives. Sustainably grown, it gives back—so sip confidently.
roasternotes: Wau Co-Op is part of the Monpi Sustainable Services organization. Formed in December 2008, Monpi Sustainable Services contributes to sustainable livelihoods by providing training on the best agricultural, environmental, social and healthcare practices in its coffee-growing communities. In this way, Monpi contributes to improving the quality of life for its coffee producers.
flavornotes: none

name: John Brown Signature Blend
descriptor: If John Brown was on a dating app, everyone would swipe right. This coffee features a deep chocolate aroma with a velvety body. Absolute keeper.
roasternotes: This cup features a deep chocolate aroma and velvety body complimented by a juicy acidity. Dark chocolate is prominent in the cup with a syrupy black cherry sweetness and a pleasant finish of sweet tobacco.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Milk Chocolate and Ripe Fruit

name: Kenya Nyeri Kiruga AA
descriptor: Earthy and full-bodied, brightened with notes of lemon and crisp green apple acidity. This is a smooth, well rounded coffee for the contemplative types.
roasternotes: A complex and very flavorful cup of coffee. This particular AA exhibits pronounced vegetal flavors layered with notes of lemon, green apple and hints of stonefruit. A very smooth cup with a full-body and rounded flavor profile.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Fresh Herb, Savoriness and Citrus

name: Decaf Los Gigantes
descriptor: Sugarcane processed for maximum sweetness, hold the calories. We're loving this as our afternoon cup - sweet and nutty, it reminds us of banana bread.
roasternotes: At the Descafecol plant in Manizales, the caﬀeine is removed, as though by magic, using naturally occurring Ethyl Acetate derived from sugar cane. You’ll ﬁnd Ethyl Acetate in green coﬀee as well as various fruits, and it is the most common ester in wine. The resulting coﬀee is intensely sweet and fruited both in aroma and ﬂavor.
flavornotes: none

name: Costa Rica Cerro La Cruz
descriptor: Rich, smooth and hazelnutty, with soft red grape acidity. A super creamy mouthfeel gives this one a boosted coziness factor you'll love on a blustery morning.
roasternotes: Cerro La Cruz is a new micro mill in the Tarrazú region and is owned by the Esquivel Bararantes family. We visited them in February 2017 as they were wrapping up their first season exclusively processing their own coffee and the results are outstanding. With their efficient setup, they are able to produce delightful limited releases that effectively capture the great quality potential of their coffee plants.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Costa Rica with hints of Milk Chocolate and Sweet Vanilla

name: Hambela Estate – Alaka
descriptor: With its jammy berry sweetness and smooth notes of milk chocolate, it's no wonder this one keeps winning awards.
roasternotes: The Hambela Estate at Alaka is the first collection station and estate started by coffee visionaries Aman and Tariku Adinew. Their company, METAD, now operates six collection stations and two estates. Hambela Estate has had a home at Blueprint Coffee for the last four harvests. In January, we won a Good Food Award with last year's harvest. This year, we find familiar fruity qualities in the coffee. Expect berry and chocolate notes to jump out of the cup.
flavornotes: Packed with bold notes of Berry Fruit, Sweet Vanilla and Milk Chocolate

name: El Salvador
descriptor: Grown exclusively for Cuvée at the very top of a mountain, this coffee is cultivated and harvested with a love that shines in the cup. Also present: full body, earthy spices, notes of toasted nuts. (Formerly known as El Salvador Laguna Las Ranas.)
roasternotes: This lot of direct trade coffee from the San Francisco Estate is an ongoing project between Cuvée Coffee and Jose Antonio Salaverria to methodically and sustainably increase quality at the farm level. Using coffee grown on only the top of the mountain known as Cerro Las Ranas, this higher elevation creates a denser coffee bean, allowing for a more consistent roast and a broader range of flavors.
flavornotes: none

name: Jackie Oh Decaf
descriptor: Notes of milk chocolate and berry candy make this one as refined as its namesake. If you're looking for a beautiful, elegant cup that won't keep you up at night, meet Jackie!
roasternotes: Lemon aromas, flavors of dried fruit and spice, aftertastes of malt and chocolate, a balanced acidity, a silky body and a mild sweetness
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Roastiness and Berry Fruit

name: Cold Brew Blend
descriptor: Smooth as silk when brewed slow like molasses, this cold brew blend is just as great hot - in fact, you'll get more berry juiciness out of a hot cup.
roasternotes: Our House Cold Brew Blend was inspired by our Blackstrap Espresso. It is a dynamic and complex cold brew with smooth molasses tones.
flavornotes: Hints of Milk Chocolate, Brown Sugar and Berry Fruit

name: Decaf Highline
descriptor: Rich and full-bodied, with an aroma like freshly hewn cedar - this is a classic, earthy, spicy, chocolaty smooth cup for any time of day.
roasternotes: This blend is our organic decaf offering. Coffees that have been gently decaffeinated using the Swiss Water Process are roasted to a medium profile to showcase expressive sweet and aromatic notes.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Milk Chocolate and Spice

name: Fresh Crop Bright
descriptor: Here’s the bright side. This is everything we love about Ethopian coffee, in a cup: citrus acidity and earthiness. Hello, optimism.
roasternotes: Fresh Crop Bright is a blend of beautiful seasonally fresh Ethiopian coffees that highlight all the things we love about Ethiopian coffee such as citrus, tropical fruits, berries and floral notes.
flavornotes: Hints of Citrus, Tropical Fruit and Florals

name: Sugar Tooth
descriptor: Sweet, without the sugar. Treat, without the guilt. When your tooth craves anything but savory, reach for vibrant sweetness with a low-cal payoff.
roasternotes: The flavor profile of Sweet Tooth aims to pack all of the juicy, vibrant sweetness available to us in our seasonal single origin menu into one engaging cup. We explore how the natural deep sweetness of coffees form Burundi can inform and support the light, bright, fruity high notes of our favorite Rwandan offering, bringing you a highly refreshing, complex brew that embodies the best of both worlds.
flavornotes: Hints of Berry Fruit, Citrus and Milk Chocolate

name: Blue Thunder
descriptor: Coming in hot: A cup combining dark and smooth coffees for an explosive combination of smokey and sweet.
roasternotes: A rich, full-bodied cup with smoky and sweet tones, resulting from a combination of our French Roast cut with a full city roast Sumatra Blue Lintong. The Blue Thunder is perfect for those who love a dark but flavorful cup!
flavornotes: Classic, nostalgic, comforting flavors

name: Papua New Guinea YUS
descriptor: Conservation is king in this region focused on sustainable farming. This coffee grows side-by-side with endangered animals—but safe to say it tastes amazing.
roasternotes: Caffe Vita has been working hand in hand with farmers to improve quality and bring this amazing coffee to market. Here, the land is ideally suited for cultivation with its altitude, rich organic soil, heirloom varietals and tropical climate. It’s an honor and privilege to roast this remarkable coffee and share in creating a better future for their families and the conservation of their land.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Papua New Guinea with hints of Brown Sugar and Nut

name: Burundi - Nkonge Natural
descriptor: With their drying equipment held hostage at customs and refusing to pay a bribe, they dried this coffee the natural way instead. The result: dark red fruit sweetness, tart acidity and a lingering, creamy mouthfeel.
roasternotes: Airship Coffee is proud to partner with the Long Miles Coffee Project in Burundi. Year after year, the team at Long Miles aids to produce amazing coffee out of Burundi, as well as some truly beautiful stories. This coffee is no different.
flavornotes: Packed with bold notes of Berry Fruit, Brown Sugar and Ripe Fruit

name: La Bicicletta Organic Blend
descriptor: Great coffee any time of day, and perfect with a dash of milk. Chocolate and fruit flavors are balanced with a mild acidity.
roasternotes: We created this blend a number of years ago to help support women’s cycling and it has been a big hit. 50 cents (not the music guy) from each bag sold goes to help fund cycling projects around the region. We think this is pretty great. The best part is that the coffee tastes fantastic. Great coffee any time of day, holds up nicely with a splash of cream. Malt, chocolate and fruit flavors, aftertastes of earth, a mild acidity and a mellow sweetness.
flavornotes: Nostalgic with hints of Tropical Fruit and Milk Chocolate

name: Guatemala
descriptor: This fully-washed coffee from the Huehuetenango region of Guatemala delivers on flavor. Chocolate, raisin, with a sweet toffee finish shine in this approachable coffee.
roasternotes: This fully-washed coffee is 100% Caturra. It comes from William Perez’s farm San Antonio Chaguite in the Agua Dulce region of Huehuetenango. Or, to put it another way, it’s fantastic. Put the water on, daylight's burnin’. Aromas of lime and chocolate, flavors of chocolate and raisin, toffee aftertastes, a balanced acidity, a smooth body and a delicate sweetness
flavornotes: A classic expression of Guatemala with hints of Milk Chocolate and Brown Sugar

name: Flecha Roja Costa Rica
descriptor: Rich volcanic soil, high elevation, and generations of farming mastery yield an incredible cup of coffee. Creamy sweetness and fruit juiciness make this one a hands-down winner.
roasternotes: Our old friend Roberto Mata started a new operation with his son Michael in 2017. In less than a year, they delivered some of the best lots we have tasted from Costa Rica this season. Canteloupe | Butterscotch | Lemon Meringue
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Tropical Fruit, Brown Sugar and Sweet Vanilla
extra: ['Process', 'Washed', 'Sub Region', 'Dota, Tarrazu', 'Producer', 'Roberto & Michael Mata', 'Harvest Time', 'January - February 2018', 'Varietal', 'Caturra, Catuai']

name: Cherry Picker
descriptor: Finding your blends too bland? This fresh pick will blow your mind. Clean and crisp, this carefully curated mix of Ethiopian single origins brings the fruit, and balances it with a clean white honey sweetness.
roasternotes: Each summer we "cherry pick" two of the best coffees we have available to us and put them together to create a fruit forward, structured and sweet blend. This year's iteration combines Ethiopia Guji Highlands, which was one of the cleanest naturally processed coffees we saw all year, and our Ethiopia Uraga which has incredible structure and florality. The resulting blend has tons of sweetness reminiscent of stone fruits and honey lavender floral notes.
flavornotes: Hints of Ripe Fruit, Berry Fruit and Sweet Vanilla

name: Ethiopia Sakaro
descriptor: If you're craving some complexity, step right up! This beautifully balanced coffee plays with ripe fruit, bright citrus acidity and delicate bergamot notes to create one deeply rewarding cup.
roasternotes: The Sakaro is a perfect example of what we look for in a Yirgacheffe coffee. Its backbone reminds us of a fine black tea. On top of that add fresh red currants, juicy, ripe raspberries and a squeeze of lime. Then intermix floral components such as the dried citrus zest of the bergamot fruit. This is a very bright, juicy, complex coffee that we are head over heels for. We hope you will be too.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Berry Fruit, Tropical Fruit and Citrus

name: Kenya Gachatha OT-18
descriptor: Right up front, we're getting big bold fruits like juicy grape and lemon - which mellow to a subtle floral sweetness that has us coming back for more.
roasternotes: Over the last few years, you might have heard of or tasted the sweet fruit of the Gachatha Cooperative. This wet mill (factory) makes some of the best Kenyan coffee. This lot lives up to the hype and has a beautiful mix of delicate and bold flavors. White grape and tamarind are quite pronounced in the cup, while botanical sugar cane and soft peach carry throughout giving this coffee an intense upfront moment that relaxes with subtleness at the end.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Tropical Fruit, Sweet Vanilla and Tropical Fruit

name: Seawall Stroll Seasonal Espresso Blend
descriptor: Floral and bright, with lovely citrus acidity, abundant stonefruit and lots of chocolaty undertones.
roasternotes: When the Port of San Francisco asked for our help in getting the word out about the vulnerability of the Embarcadero Seawall, we admit that we’d never heard of this key piece of infrastructure. As a proud San Francisco company, we’ve partnered with the Port and other iconic SF companies to bring you this seaworthy and eﬀervescent reason to get buzzed and celebrate the waterfront. Find out more at sfseawall.com.
flavornotes: none

name: La Roca, Nicaragua
descriptor: Beautifully balanced with bright lemony-lime acidity, rich red fruit and a silky finish.
roasternotes: The coﬀees are picked by hand on steep terrain located in some of the highest mountains in Nicaragua. Processing is done on the individual farms, with each producer responsible for the quality of their contribution. This particular oﬀering showcases the sweetness we love from Nicaraguan coﬀees, balanced with the shining acidity we love from high-grown, carefully processed cherries.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Tropical Fruit, Citrus and Sweet Vanilla

name: Miramar, Mexico
descriptor: Sweet and bright, fruity and rich - this Oaxacan beauty is a study in balance.
roasternotes: A clean balanced cup paired with high sweetness and acidity.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Mexico with hints of Milk Chocolate and Berry Fruit

name: 10 Year Anniversary Blend
descriptor: What does ten years of hard work, thoughtful sourcing, and incredible roasting talent taste like? Well, we're getting plenty of deep plum sweetness and bright grapefruit acidity.
roasternotes: A very deep and expansive cup filled to the brim with sweetness and pleasant acidity. This coffee has stone fruit, flowers, grapefruit, and currant to spare.
flavornotes: Hints of Ripe Fruit, Citrus and Florals

name: Ethiopia Layo Teraga Washed
descriptor: Bright and sweet with a dried apricot sweetness and notes of smooth vanilla. Its clean, crisp body delivers delicate tea-like astringency that lingers like a sweet perfume.
roasternotes: This lot is from our very first trip to Ethiopia! Arriving a week after the country declared State Of Emergency status, the trip went very smoothly and we met nothing but friendly people. It seemed like every time we stepped out of a car, a woman was setting up an Ethiopian Coffee Ceremony for us. Everyone just made us feel so welcome.
flavornotes: none

name: Juan Domingo, Guatemala
descriptor: Subtle and nuanced as a fine wine, with vibrant fruitiness softened by notes of chocolate and hazelnut. For the femme fatale in all of us.
roasternotes: Juan Domingo starts with a vibrant fruitiness touched with a tannic foundation that reminds us of white grapes and ripe plums. This develops into a creamy sweetness marked by milk chocolate and hazelnut; ultimately ending in an aftertaste that reminds us of sparkling rosé. This coffee is a beautiful representation of the best Huehuetenango has to offer - approachable, yet sophisticated. It is the perfect cup to share with just about anyone in any setting.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Berry Fruit, Ripe Fruit and Nut

name: Guatemala, El Sendero, Renardo Ovalle
descriptor: As smooth and balanced as a blend, with all the character of a single origin. Rich and smooth, this coffee expertly balances chocolaty sweetness with bright, jammy fruit notes.
roasternotes: In 1958, Dr. Jorge Vides purchased land in a deep valley located in Huehuetenango. Today Dr. Vides’ daughter, Maria Elena Vides de Ovalle, and her son Renardo Ovalle, produce this beautiful coffee on small parcel called “El Sendero,” perched high in surrounding hills. This coffee showcases notes of marmalade, hibiscus, and sugar cane.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Guatemala with hints of Brown Sugar and Citrus

name: Guatemala Lazaro Constanza
descriptor: We're loving this silky-smooth, well-balanced beauty. Bright lemony acidity up front is tamed by a round caramel sweetness, yielding a beautifully balanced, classic cup.
roasternotes: This lovely coffee was grown (at 1900 meters!) and processed in Agua Dulce, Huehuetenango. The caturra and typica cherries are de-pulped and wet-fermented for about 36 hours, before being dried on patios. This coffee is silky and clean, with pointed citric acidity rounded out by classic caramel and cocoa sweetness. A beautiful, classic Guatemalan coffee.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Citrus, Milk Chocolate and Ripe Fruit

name: La Colina Guatemala
descriptor: Vibrant to the point of electrifying! Clean and crisp, with so-bright-you're-gonna-need-shades berry acidity. As the cup cools, we're finding notes of honeysuckle and granny smith apple in an exceptionally clean body.
roasternotes: This coffee explodes on the palate with clean, bright berry acidity and opens up with layers of apple, flowers, and citrus.
flavornotes: none

name: Ethiopia Gera Limmu
descriptor: Delicate and sweet, with an airy orangey acidity that works perfectly with its notes of jasmine and marzipan sweetness.
roasternotes: This coffee comes to us from Gera Farm, an estate that stretches over vast highland areas in western Ethiopia. We are continually amazed by the farm's commitment to sustainability and employee well-being. The farm has placed a large focus on employee working conditions and provides housing, education, and healthcare programs for all of their employees free of charge. Gera Farm's investment pays off big with this world-class coffee. Enjoy!
flavornotes: none

name: Colombia Las Brisas
descriptor: This lush, full-bodied coffee evokes a slice of cherry pie: deep, ripe red fruit acidity with a brown sugary sweetness that lingers.
roasternotes: Huckleberry has been roasting Las Brisas for 4 years, and we're stoked to partner with ASOQUEBRADON for the long haul. This group of growers in Rioblanco, Tolima, consistently produces juicy, dynamic, and delicious coffees that combine bright fruit flavors with caramel-like sweetness.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Roastiness, Ripe Fruit and Citrus

name: Tikur Anbessa Organic Ethiopia
descriptor: An aroma like clementines and hibiscus draws us right in to this cup of sunshine - orange marmalade sweetness invites us to stay for another round.
roasternotes: The 2018 edition of Tikur Anbessa, named for Ethiopia's Black Lion, is roaring good, with sugary sweetness, juicy citrus acidity and complex floral notes. Seville Orange | Sugarcane | Hibiscus
flavornotes: A classic expression of Ethiopia with hints of Citrus and Brown Sugar

name: Colombia, El Meridiano, Tolima
descriptor: Sweet and juicy, with mouth-watering peachy notes and a drying white grape juice acidity.
roasternotes: ASOCEAS, Asociación de Productores de Café Especial del Alto Saldana, is a group of about 50 small producers in the growing region of Tolima, Colombia. Throughout the year this coffee dances around clean and round flavors of stonefruits, grapes, and sugary caramel notes. This region is close to the equator and diverse in it’s microclimates, so there is a continual harvest happening almost year round guaranteeing fresh flavors and character in every sip.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Colombia with hints of Ripe Fruit and Ripe Fruit

name: Decaf Ethiopia Kercha
descriptor: Decaf can be a tough one to nail down, but this Kercha is an all-around winner. If you're looking for big fruit flavor without the added caffeine - right this way, please!
roasternotes: Strawberries, sweetness, this is the kind of coffee you can bring home to meet your parents. Brought to you by the fine folks at Swiss Water Process and packaged in Grain Pro for extended enjoyment. We are proud to offer one of the finest decaf programs in the Pacific Northwest... the US....the World!
flavornotes: none

name: Kenya Kiganjo
descriptor: Sweet, bright, and crisp as a fresh-picked Granny Smith apple, with delicate notes of honeysuckle to bring even more finesse to this lovely cup.
roasternotes: Kiganjo is a factory of the Thirirka Farmers Cooperative, founded in Kiambu County, Kenya. We love this coffee for its distinctive flavors: apple, blueberry, lime, almost-Ethiopian floral aromatics. Very clean, crisp and refreshing.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Tropical Fruit, Florals and Berry Fruit

name: Kolla Bolcha, Ethiopia
descriptor: Subtly earthy and sweet, with a soft papaya-like acidity. This one delivers lovely citrusy notes with a delicate hand.
roasternotes: The coﬀee is washed and graded through the use of channels that separate the coﬀee by density. To ﬁnish the drying process, the coﬀee is moved into the sunlight for 1-2 weeks until the moisture stabilizes and the coﬀee is ready to mill and export. Extreme care is taken at every step of the process.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Earthiness, Tropical Fruit and Citrus

name: Guatemala Finca Palestina Natural
descriptor: So super lush, sweet and fruity, with a lingering sweet-clean finish. This one reminds us of strawberry cotton candy.
roasternotes: Another complete stunner from our friend Joel at Finca Palestina. This is one of our Farm Direct coffees, sourced directly on our annual trip down to Guatemala to visit our friends in the Acatenango Valley. We were more than happy to find this natural-processed bourbon variety in Joel's lineup. It's bright red fruit character rivals the sweetness of an Ethiopian natural, but with all the texture of a coffee from Guatemala.
flavornotes: Packed with bold notes of Berry Fruit, Sweet Vanilla and Berry Fruit

name: Ethiopia Yabitu Koba
descriptor: Juicy and sweet, with a soft peachy acidity and a lovely honey sweetness that lingers.
roasternotes: Managed by Feku Jebril, the Hana Asrat Washing Station in the Yabitu Koba village specializes in washed coffees — after 24-48 hours in the fermentation tanks, this coffee was soaked for 4 hours to stabilize moisture content and water activity before dried on raised beds. This is absolutely one of our favorite coffees; it has a jammy lushness and taste notes of peach cobbler, honey, lots of florals. It is simultaneously crisp and refined and soft and juicy.
flavornotes: none

descriptor: This one’s a throwback to coffee’s globetrotting heritage, combining the sweet and spice of the traders who sailed the world in search of a killer cup.
roasternotes: Routinely ranked as a staff favorite, The 1950 blend pays homage to coffee’s journey around the globe and the spice traders who transported it. Profiled to highlight its dense, candy-like sweetness and complex spice profile; the 1950 blend performs in both filter and espresso methods, with or without the accompaniment of milk.
flavornotes: Hints of Spice, Citrus and Sweet Vanilla

name: Streetlevel
descriptor: This dynamic blend takes Verve’s roaster ethos to the streets with an accessible espresso-citrus balance that feels essentially democratic (coffee for all).
roasternotes: Crafted to serve as the backbone for our milk drink offerings, Streetlevel Espresso is quintessentially sweet, combining balanced notes of ripe stone fruits and zesty citrus with a syrupy sweetness. Look for a hint of citrus as espresso and a touch more roast development as brewed coffee.
flavornotes: none

name: Onyx Blend
descriptor: Word on the street: This specialty blend named for the roaster’s address is something of a force of nature. It’s milky, rich and just a little bit mysterious.
roasternotes: Our newest specialty blend named after the street of our new roastery, the Onyx Blend. We've crafted the blend to feature sweet notes of milk chocolate, almonds and a bright, tropical fruit finish. The blend is reminiscent of the mystical properties found within the onyx gemstone. An earth element, the onyx stone is known for promoting inner strength, focused attention, and strong will power...just like a cup of this perfectly balanced coffee.
flavornotes: Hints of Milk Chocolate, Nut and Tropical Fruit

name: Daterra, Brazil
descriptor: Here’s one coffee grown to pay attention to details. Its farm is designated the most sustainable in Brazil, with innovative methods that make a unique cup.
roasternotes: A farm like no other, Daterra is at once massive in scope and yet scrupulous in detail. Named the most sustainable farm in Brazil, this massive estate focuses on a triple bottom line: People, Planet, Profit. We are presenting this as a foundational offering. This coffee will be held in deep freeze storage in its green, unroasted state and we will attempt to have it available year-round.
flavornotes: Packed with bold notes of Milk Chocolate, Brown Sugar and Ripe Fruit

name: Los Sueños Decaf
descriptor: A clean coffee that stands up strong to its caffeinated counterparts. Delicious and sweet, and one to keep.
roasternotes: Selected by our green buying team in Acevedo, Colombia, this lot was then sent to a decaffeination plant in Colombia where it was processed using Ethyl Acetate derived from Colombian grown sugar cane. Fruited, clean, sweet—we think this is a truly delicious coffee.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Tropical Fruit and Sweet Vanilla

name: Gatomboya, Kenya
descriptor: Get your paradoxes in before 8 a.m., with this cup that proves elegance can be powerful, and coffee can be both balanced and extreme. A standout with restraint.
roasternotes: Many of our favorite coffees come from Kenya. The acidic loam soil, plant genetics and processing interact in unimaginable ways that create a cup at once balanced and extreme, elegant and powerful. A classic Nyeri profile, this lot from Gatomboya has heightened sweetness and acidity. The fruited qualities are reminiscent of fresh raspberry and blackcurrant (a tasting note fairly unique to Kenyan coffees), underpinned by a plush nougat-like quality.
flavornotes: none

name: Buufata Konga, Ethiopia
descriptor: Jasmine/coffee blossom aromatics are bolstered by complex citrus ranging from bergamot to meyer-lemon, supported by ripe stone fruit qualities and underpinned by a profound sweetness reminiscent of raw honey.
roasternotes: Buufata Konga comes to us through a private washing station in Yirga Cheffe, southern Ethiopia. Remarkably well processed, this coffee was too delicious to turn down when a sample came across our cupping table in early spring of 2017.
flavornotes: Acid forward with hints of Citrus, Sweet Vanilla and Florals

name: Gesha Village 2016 Dry Process
descriptor: A unique coffee collection as it's stored unroasted in deep freeze, this naturally processed coffee is incredibly clean and complex. Tasty layers of red and white grape, stone fruit and citrus.
roasternotes: Incredibly clean, this is naturally processed coffee done with precision. Remarkably complex, this cup presents layers of red grape, white grape, stone fruit and citrus. This release represents the second dry processed lot that the Passenger green buying team purchased from the 2015/2016 harvest at Gesha Village. This coffee has been held in deep freeze storage in its green (raw, unroasted) state, since it landed, preserving its freshness indefinitely.
flavornotes: Packed with bold notes of Berry Fruit, Citrus and Ripe Fruit

name: Kanzu, Rwanda
descriptor: Dried apricot, raisin, panela, citrus, and even slight jasmine on the nose introduce a very attractive cup full of flavors ranging from baked apple and pear to raspberry.
roasternotes: Since the end of the war in 1994, Rwanda has been the attention of very focused international aid in many areas, including agriculture. The result of this aid has been the rapid rise to stardom of the countries’ specialty coffee sector. Dried apricot, raisin, panela, citrus, and even slight jasmine on the nose introduce a very attractive cup full of flavors ranging from baked apple and pear to raspberry.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Sweet Vanilla, Ripe Fruit and Berry Fruit

name: Colombia Jhon Wilson Poveda
descriptor: Lovely caramel-toffee sweetness meets bright berries and delicate citrusy acidity in this well-balanced cup.
roasternotes: Jhon Wilson Poveda’s coffee possesses characteristics that our green coffee buying team strongly associates with Acevedo: citrus, caramel and cooked berries! For the past three years our green coffee buying team has spent quite a bit of time in Acevedo, Southern Huila. We have tasted Jhon Wilson Poveda’s coffee dozens of times over the years. Always intrigued by it, this year we pulled the trigger on buying some of this Acevedo Cup winning lot.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Colombia with hints of Citrus and Berry Fruit

name: Filadelpo Mejia
descriptor: Delicate, complex, and subtle - this is the kind of coffee worthy of undivided attention. Soft green grape acidity meets subtle caramel sweetness.
roasternotes: Filadelpo Mejia’s coffee possesses intense red and tropical fruit aromatics. In the cup there is an incredible depth of sweetness. This organically produced Caturra lot won 6th place in the 2017 Peru Cup of Excellence. Always an accomplishment, 2017 was a particularly exciting year to win the Peru Cup of Excellence owing to the fact that it was the first year this prestigious competition was held in this South American country.
flavornotes: Complex with notes of Berry Fruit, Ripe Fruit and Sweet Vanilla

name: Arnaud Causse Pacamara
descriptor: Immensely lush, flooding the cup with notes of plum, honey, and toasted almonds. This is no doubt a distinct coffee, but one that's easy for anyone to enjoy.
roasternotes: Several factors ranging from supply and demand to cost of labor in Ecuador align to make coffees from this South American country quite expensive. Not only do we at Passenger think that Ecuador is an important country to present from the perspective of flavor and terroir, but we also think it is important to present coffees that start to approach a truly sustainable supply chain.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Ecuador with hints of Ripe Fruit and Nut

name: Las Acacias, Honduras
descriptor: Nutty and sweet, with notes of toasty pecans and milk chocolate balanced by a soft red grape acidity.
roasternotes: The number of Honduran producers committing to more quality-focused practices is growing year after year. Finca Las Acaias is one of several farms owned by Roger Antonio Domínguez Márquez in La Paz, Marcala. This coffee is picked and depulped on the same day, dry-fermented in tanks for 18-hours, washed three times, and dried on raised beds for 12-15 days.
flavornotes: A classic expression of Honduras with hints of Ripe Fruit and Milk Chocolate

name: Decaf Espresso
descriptor: Depth of flavor isn't lacking here, with notes of honey sweetness. Say yes to lingering chocolate notes, say no to lingering jitters.
roasternotes: Our decaf Brazil is roasted darker for espresso in order to accentuate the chocolate and honey notes found in the coffee. A lighter bodied espresso with a medium-long finish.
flavornotes: none

name: Blueboon
descriptor: The goldilocks of coffees, this cup is just right. It’s versatile and approachable, for new and seasoned drinkers alike.
roasternotes: Blueboon is an incredibly versatile blend and a cornerstone of our offerings. This is our go-to Saturday morning cup, perfect for any brew method and approachable enough to satisfy any palate.
flavornotes: Hints of Milk Chocolate, Citrus and Ripe Fruit

name: Stowaway
descriptor: There’s something familiar about this complex yet comfortable blend that melds to your preferences. You’ll want to stow some away so it’s always at the ready.
roasternotes: A deeply satisfying and agreeable coffee, Stowaway aims to present familiar and loved flavors to every coffee consumer. Enjoy Stowaway as a complex and balanced standalone espresso, a plush and delicious espresso-based milk drink or as a familiar yet intriguing brewed coffee.
flavornotes: A traditional base with hints of Milk Chocolate and Brown Sugar
